result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Lee Hughey Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger Lee Hughey Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Roger Lee Hughey Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
OFF THE RECORD:  Defendant was recently moved to Dodge Correctional and was not produced for today's court.  Defense counsel requests that defendant be produced in person for next court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Case rescheduled off the record.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Roger Lee Hughey not in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING(9 pages) commencing  6-7-22 by Kathleen S. Worden.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Roger Lee Hughey not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 35
Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in court, appear by video with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent, appear by video  Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Officer R. Kwasinski.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (new criminal charges), filed.

Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel. Attorney Sargent to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in court, in custody.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for preliminary hearing. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Services Violation Report (positive drug test), filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision Level 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Roger Lee Hughey in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roger Lee Hughey appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.     Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.   
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with JMB (DOB 9.30.2001)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
